answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens can initially go to employment agencies to register with an identity document to find a job.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'How can Ukrainian citizens who come from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine work in Romania'.

answers.answer: An identity document is required for registration at employment agencies, and a self-responsibility statement is necessary for signing the employment contract.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'How can Ukrainian citizens who come from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine work in Romania'.

answers.answer: The National Agency for Employment, UNHCR (through its compiled list of organizations), Adecco platform, and Ateliere Fără Frontiere (AFF) offer employment support.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Organizations Providing Support in Employment for Refugees'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens can access job opportunities by registering with employment agencies, using platforms like Jobs4Ukraine and Adecco, or seeking assistance from organizations such as Ateliere Fără Frontiere.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Guidance is available on signing employment contracts, and organizations offer consultations on labor rights and legislation. Additionally, a guide provides an understanding of the legal aspects for finding a job.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Guidance on access to the labor market'.

answers.answer: The Jobs4Ukraine platform assists by providing easy and free access to job opportunities, both abroad and remote, to help individuals rebuild their financial stability.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Job search on the Jobs4Ukraine platform'.

answers.answer: The National Agency for Employment, through its territorial structures, offers several free services to Ukrainian citizens who are registered with the NAE.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Free services offered to Ukrainian citizens for their integration into the Romanian labour market'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens can still register and find a job through employment agencies even if they do not have qualification or experience documents.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'How can Ukrainian citizens who come from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine work in Romania'.

answers.answer: The employment guides provide information on how to look for a job, advice on creating a resume, preparing for interviews, rules for completing documents, and an introduction to the Romanian employment system, including legal aspects.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Ukrainian citizens can ensure legal and safe work by completing the necessary self-responsibility statement for the employment contract and by consulting guides and organizations that provide information on legal aspects, labor rights, and legislation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/job-for-refugees-from-ukraine-in-romania and read the section under 'Guidance on access to the labor market'.
